short_summary: The department of National Defence has a requirement for straight battery chargers to be delivered to Gatineau Haiti Prepared Airport by November 24 2022.
description:
NOTICE OF PROPOSED PROCUREMENT

Note: Due to the impacts to the COVID-19 Pandemic, reduced business hours and limited staff available at the specified bid receiving Unit, on the front page of the Bid Solicitation document, bidders are strongly encouraged to transmit their bids electronically using the epost Connect service instead of any of the other methods of bid delivery usually available.

The Department of National Defence has a requirement for the items detailed below.  The delivery is requested to be delivered to 25 CFSD Montreal by March 2024

Item 1, 6130 NSN: 6130-01-518-6925, Charger, Battery
Part No.: ALPHA C-25 NCAGE: 3RCD2.
Quantity: 10, Unit of Issue: EA, to be delivered to 25 CFSD Montreal.

Item 2, GSIN: 6130 NSN: 6130-01-462-6337, Analyzer-Charger, Battery
Part No.: Beta D-50, NCAGE: 3RCD2
Quantity: 10, Unit of Issue: EA, to be delivered to 25 CFSD Montreal.

Item 3, GSIN: 4920 NSN: 4920-01-498-2543, Battery Charger, Air
Part No.: CA-1550-MIL NCAGE: 3RCD2
Quantity: 10, Unit of Issue: EA, to be delivered to 25 CFSD Montreal.

Item 4, GSIN: 6130, NSN: 6130-01-558-8647, Battery Charger
Part No.: CA-1550-CML, NCAGE: 3RCD2
Quantity: 5, Unit of Issue: EA, to be delivered to 25 CFSD Montreal.

Item 5, GSIN: 6130, NSN: 6130-01-361-0642, Analyzer-Charger, Battery
Part No.: 121630-001, NCAGE: 02294
Quantity: 10, Unit of Issue: EA, to be delivered to 25 CFSD Montreal.

Bidders proposing an Equivalent or a Substitute Product must indicate the brand name and model and/or Part Number and the NCAGE they are offering.

The Crown retains the rights to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
full_summary:
### Aircraft Battery Charger

#### Solicitation Number
W8485-247979/A

#### Posting Date
12/08/2023

#### Closing Date
01/17/2024

#### Description
The Department of National Defence is soliciting bids for the delivery of aircraft battery chargers and an associated battery analyzer. The procurement includes a total of five items:

1. 10 units of Charger, Battery (NSN 6130-01-518-6925)
2. 10 units of Analyzer-Charger, Battery (NSN 6130-01-462-6337)
3. 10 units of Battery Charger, Air (NSN 4920-01-498-2543)
4. 5 units of Battery Charger (NSN 6130-01-558-8647)
5. 10 units of Analyzer-Charger, Battery (NSN 6130-01-361-0642)

The proposed bidder must indicate the brand name, model number, and/or part number, as well as the National Codification Bureau (NCAGE) code for the approved charger and analyzer.

#### Delivery Location
The delivery of the goods will be to the Canadian Forces Support Squadron Montreal, 25 CFSD Montreal.

#### Selection Criteria
The lowest price will be the selection criteria.

#### Trade Agreements
The bidding process is open to suppliers who have a Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) or World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA).

#### Important Notice
Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the Department of National Defence recommends transmitting bids electronically using the epost Connect service instead of traditional methods.

#### Contact Information
Dany Lebel

Email: dany.lebel2@forces.gc.ca

 Phone: (000) 000-0000

#### Documents

[Notice of Proposed Procurement](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/27166/w8485-247979-a-bid-solicitation-en.pdf?id=38479398)

[Notice of Proposed Procurement (Français)](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/27166/w8485-247979-a-bid-solicitation-fr.pdf?id=38479399)

---

Conclusion
The government requires 5 types of aircraft chargers to be delivered to 25 CFSD Montreal. Only bids with NCAGE numbers or similar equivalent chargers will be considered.
